title: Manasseh of Judah
summary: Manasseh (/mÉ™ËˆnÃ¦sÉ™/; Hebrew: ×Ö°× Ö·×©Ö¶Ö¼××”â€ MÉ™naÅ¡Å¡Ã©, "Forgetter"; Akkadian: ğ’ˆ¨ğ’ˆ¾ğ’‹›ğ’„¿ MenasÃ® [me-na-si-i]; Greek: ÎœÎ±Î½Î±ÏƒÏƒá¿†Ï‚ Manasses; Latin: Manasses) was the fourteenth king of the Kingdom of Judah. He was the oldest of the sons of Hezekiah and his mother Hephzibah (2 Kings 21:1). He became king at the age of 12 and reigned for 55 years (2 Kings 21:1; 2 Chronicles 33:1).
